thread.title: Motor racing-Williams appoint Rowland as 'official young driver'

title: Motor racing-Williams appoint Rowland as 'official young driver'
text: February 23, 2018 / 7:01 PM / Updated 3 hours ago Motor racing - Williams appoint Rowland as 'official young driver' Reuters Staff 1 Min Read LONDON (Reuters) - Britain’s Oliver Rowland has been appointed “official young driver” for Williams even though, at 25, he is older than both of those who will be racing for the Formula One team this season. The former champions have Canadian Lance Stroll, 19, and Russian rookie Sergey Sirotkin, 22, as their confirmed race drivers. Williams said Rowland, who was third overall in Formula Two last season and will race in this year’s World Endurance Championship, would help in the simulator and drive the FW41 car at a young driver test. Reporting by Alan Baldwin, editing by Toby Davis
